column4: nitorb: no "Places" there.  BTW I'm on 10.04 (basically wanting to check my backup on sdb2 before upgrading)
i wouldnt mind a scratch install but then theres so much to redo
i have used Clonezilla to grab the entire partition as a backup
did you have vhosts? mysql db's?
just a local web dev box
i don't mean specifically an upgrade. A scratch install is OK so long as I have backed up what I need
i'm trying to "move" from 10.04 -> 12.04, unless it's not worth it
there are no issues upgrading from LTS to LTS is supported
it's suggested to wait untill 12.04.1
yes clonezilla you can clone your drive.  or you can just tar up your home would be sufficient backup
oh if you have a server then no
just bootup a clonezilla livecd and image the drive to a removable drive
then you have nothing to worry about unless your image is bad
is there a reason you need to upgrade at this minute?
not really
all my servers are still running 10.04
As others have stated with the issues people experience. I just wait on my servers untill LTS .1
then others have debugged any issues I may experience
if you have a backup though what's there to lose I guess. It's up to you.
you're not going to see anything earth shatering from upgrading to 12.04
